channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024081161
item.description:
Report X-2024081161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A pallet with 3 drums loaded onto it collapsed while in transit to service center 003. When the pallet collapsed, the drums were jostled and one of the drums leaked approximately 1 cup of material from the cap on top of the drum. The material pooled on top of the drum but a small amount also got ont o the trailer floor. CURA was contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024081248
item.description:
Report X-2024081248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG SHE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HER SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/2 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report E-2024080448
item.description:
Report E-2024080448

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 2034 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Saint Louis, Missouri regarding the release of Kem-Tek Pool & Spa Care Swimming Pool Muriatic Acid (UN1789, Hydrochloric Acid Solution, 8, III). Hepaco contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all cleanup activities. Upon the arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 2 gallons from (2) 1-gallon plastic jugs of material. The release impacted a pallet, 5 other boxes of cargo, and a 8ft-by-8ft area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The undamaged cargo was removed from the damaged boxes and placed in (1) 55-gallon DF to be forwarded to the original consignee. The damaged boxes, pallet, and spent absorbents were containerized in (2) 55-gallon DF's as waste and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
